name: BNSF Railway Company v. Loos
question: Are damages for lost wages "compensation" under the Railroad Retirement Tax Act and thus subject to employment taxes?
description: A case in which the Court will decide whether under the Railroad Retirement Tax Act, a railroad company's payment to an employee for time lost from work is compensation subject to employment taxes.

name: Carpenter v. Murphy
question: Do the 1866 territorial boundaries of the Creek Nation within the former Indian Territory of eastern Oklahoma constitute an “Indian reservation” today under 18 U.S.C. § 1151(a)?
description: A case in which the Court will decide whether the 1866 territorial boundaries of the Creek Nation within the former Indian Territory of eastern Oklahoma constitute an “Indian reservation” today under 18 U.S.C. § 1151(a).

name: Advocate Health Care Network v. Stapleton
question: Does the exemption to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) for church plans apply when the plan is maintained by an otherwise qualifying church-affiliated organization even though a church did not establish the plan?
description: A case in which the Court determined that the “church plan” exemption of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) applies to plans that are maintained by a qualifying church-affiliated organization, even if that organization did not originally establish the plan.

name: Bravo-Fernandez v. United States
question: Under the Double Jeopardy Clause, does the fact that a decision was vacated as unconstitutional prevent that case's acquittal from barring further prosecution on issues already decided in the defendant’s favor?
description: A case in which the Court decided that the Double Jeopardy Clause does not bar retrial when a jury returns an inconsistent verdict of conviction and acquittal and the convictions are later vacated for a completely separate legal error.

name: Adoptive Couple v. Baby Girl
question:
Can a non-custodial parent invoke ICWA to block an adoption voluntarily and lawfully initiated by a non-Indian parent under state law?

Does ICWA define "parent" to include an unwed biological father who has not complied with state law rules to attain legal status as a parent?
description: A case in which the Court held that a non-custodial parent cannot stop an adoption made lawfully by a non-Indian parent by invoking the ICWA.

name: Marx v. General Revenue Corporation
question: Did the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act prevent the district court from awarding costs to the General Revenue Corporation unless Marx filed her claim in bad faith and for the purpose of harassment?
description: A case in which the Court held that the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure awards costs to the prevailing party unless a statute explicitly states otherwise.

name: Tarrant Regional Water District v. Herrmann
question:
Did Congress' approval of an interstate water compact illustrate congressional intent to allow state laws to interfere with interstate commerce in water?

Does the Compact preempt protectionist state laws that restrict state access to water to which they are entitled under the Compact?
description: A case in which the Court held that Congress’ approval of an interstate water compact does not violate the Commerce Clause and that the compact does respect state lines.

name: Astra USA v. Santa Clara County
question: Can health care providers sue drug makers for overcharging public hospitals for prescription drugs?
description: A case in which the Court held that health care providers cannot sue drug makers for overcharging public hospitals for prescription drugs.

name: Henderson v. Shinseki
question: Is the time limit in 38 U.S.C. § 7266(a) subject to equitable tolling?
description: A case in which the Court held that missing the deadline for filing a notice of appeal with the Veterans Court did not bar a plaintiff from making a claim.

name: AT&T Corp. v. Hulteen
question: Under the Court's decisions in Pallas and Landgraf, does a company violate the Pregnancy Discrimination Act of 1978 (PDA) and Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 by denying retirement benefits to women who took temporary disability leave while pregnant when the leave was taken before the PDA came into effect but the calculation of benefits took place after?
description: A case in which the Court held that a company does not violate the Pregnancy Discrimination Act (PDA) or Title VII when it denies retirement benefits to women who took a temporary disability leave while pregnant when the leave was taken before the PDA came into effect.

name: Crawford v. Nashville and Davidson County, TN
question: Does the anti-retaliation provision of Title VII of the Civil Rights Act apply to employees fired for participating in an internal investigation of sexual harassment?
description: A case in which the Court held that the anti-retaliation provision of Title VII extends to people who participate in an internal investigation, even if they are not speaking on their own initiative.

name: Gross v. FBL Financial Services, Inc.
question: Does a plaintiff need to submit direct evidence of discrimination in a suit filed under the ADEA in order to shift the burden of persuasion to the defendant?
description: A case in which the Court held that a plaintiff must show that age was the "but-for" cause for the defendant's action in an Age Discrimination in Employment Act claim.

name: Engquist v. Oregon Department of Agriculture
question: Does the Court's ruling in Village of Willowbrook v. Olech, 528 U.S. 562 (2000), allow so-called "class of one" equal protection claims against government bodies in the context of employment discrimination?

name: Gonzalez v. United States
question: May a magistrate judge conduct voir dire if she has received approval from attorneys for both sides, but has not directly sought or received approval from the defendant?

name: Marrama v. Citizens Bank of Massachusetts
question: Can the right in Section 706(a) of the Bankruptcy Code to convert a Chapter 7 bankruptcy to another chapter be denied because of bad faith?

name: Lockhart v. United States
question: Could the United States offset Social Security benefits to collect a student loan debt that had been outstanding for over 10 years?

name: Lockhart v. United States
question: Could the United States offset Social Security benefits to collect a student loan debt that had been outstanding for over 10 years?

name: Scheidler v. National Organization for Women, Inc.
question: Does the Hobbs Act prohibit violence unrelated to extortion or robbery?

name: Scheidler v. National Organization for Women, Inc.
question: Does the Hobbs Act prohibit violence unrelated to extortion or robbery?

name: Bates v. Dow Agrosciences LLC
question: Does the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (FIFRA) preempt farmers' state tort claims alleging that Dow's herbicide damaged crops?

name: Bates v. Dow Agrosciences LLC
question: Does the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (FIFRA) preempt farmers' state tort claims alleging that Dow's herbicide damaged crops?

name: Mayle v. Felix
question: Federal habeas law allowed an amended petition to relate back to the filing date of the original petition if both arose out out of the same "conduct, transaction or occurrence" the original set forth. Did the trial and conviction qualify as a "conduct, transaction or occurrence?"

name: Mayle v. Felix
question: Federal habeas law allowed an amended petition to relate back to the filing date of the original petition if both arose out out of the same "conduct, transaction or occurrence" the original set forth. Did the trial and conviction qualify as a "conduct, transaction or occurrence?"

name: Stewart v. Dutra Construction Company
question: Is a dredge a "vessel" under the Longshore and Harbor Workers' Compensation Act (LHWCA)?

name: Stewart v. Dutra Construction Company
question: Is a dredge a "vessel" under the Longshore and Harbor Workers' Compensation Act (LHWCA)?

name: Lamie v. United States Trustee
question: Did Congress intend to omit bankruptcy attorneys from the list of people a corporation could pay during Chapter 7 bankruptcy proceedings?

name: Lamie v. United States Trustee
question: Did Congress intend to omit bankruptcy attorneys from the list of people a corporation could pay during Chapter 7 bankruptcy proceedings?

name: United States v. Flores-Montano
question: Does the Fourth Amendment require customs officers at the international border to have reasonable suspicion in order to remove, disassemble, and search a vehicle's gas tank for illegal material?

name: United States v. Flores-Montano
question: Does the Fourth Amendment require customs officers at the international border to have reasonable suspicion in order to remove, disassemble, and search a vehicle's gas tank for illegal material?

name: Archer v. Warner
question: Does the Bankruptcy Code cover a debt embodied in a settlement agreement that settled a creditor's earlier claim "for money...obtained by...fraud?"

name: Archer v. Warner
question: Does the Bankruptcy Code cover a debt embodied in a settlement agreement that settled a creditor's earlier claim "for money...obtained by...fraud?"

name: Black & Decker Disability Plan v. Nord
question: Under ERISA, are companies required to defer to the decision of a disability claimant's personal physician?

name: Black & Decker Disability Plan v. Nord
question: Under ERISA, are companies required to defer to the decision of a disability claimant's personal physician?

name: Breuer v. Jim's Concrete of Brevard, Inc.
question: In providing for suits under the FLSA, did Congress bar removal of such actions from state to federal court?

name: Breuer v. Jim's Concrete of Brevard, Inc.
question: In providing for suits under the FLSA, did Congress bar removal of such actions from state to federal court?

name: Bell v. Cone
question: Does defense counsel render ineffective assistance during the sentencing phase of a murder trial by failing to present mitigating evidence and waiving final argument?

name: Bell v. Cone
question: Does defense counsel render ineffective assistance during the sentencing phase of a murder trial by failing to present mitigating evidence and waiving final argument?

name: Chevron U.S.A., Inc. v. Echazabal
question: Does the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 permit the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission's regulation that allows the defense that a worker's disability on the job would pose a direct threat to his health?

name: Chevron U.S.A., Inc. v. Echazabal
question: Does the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 permit the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission's regulation that allows the defense that a worker's disability on the job would pose a direct threat to his health?

name: Edelman v. Lynchburg College
question: Is the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission's regulation, which permits the verification of a timely filed discrimination charge after the limitations period, valid?

name: Texas v. Cobb
question: Does the Sixth Amendment right to counsel extend to crimes that are "factually related" to those that have actually been charged?

name: Fischer v. United States
question: Do Medicare funds received by health care providers constitute "benefits" within the meaning of the federal bribery statute prohibiting fraud and other offenses against organizations receiving federal benefits?

name: Fischer v. United States
question: Do Medicare funds received by health care providers constitute "benefits" within the meaning of the federal bribery statute prohibiting fraud and other offenses against organizations receiving federal benefits?

name: New York v. Hill
question: Does a defense counsel's agreement to a trial date outside the 180-day time period required by Article III of the Interstate Agreement on Detainers waive the defendant's right to a speedy trial?

name: Hughes Aircraft Company v. Jacobson
question: Did an employer violate federal pension protection law when it amended its retirement plan by establishing an early retirement program and creating a noncontributory benefit structure for new participants?

name: Hughes Aircraft Company v. Jacobson
question: Did an employer violate federal pension protection law when it amended its retirement plan by establishing an early retirement program and creating a noncontributory benefit structure for new participants?

name: Your Home Visiting Nurse Services, Inc. v. Shalala
question: Can Medicare-reimbursed health care providers appeal a fiscal intermediary's refusal to reopen previous reimbursement decisions?

name: Your Home Visiting Nurse Services, Inc. v. Shalala
question: Can Medicare-reimbursed health care providers appeal a fiscal intermediary's refusal to reopen previous reimbursement decisions?

name: Bates v. United States
question: Does 20 USC section 1097(a), which makes it a felony "knowingly and willfully" to misapply student loan funds insured under Title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965, require an allegation and proof that a defendant specifically intended to injure or defraud either the United States as loan guarantor or another?

name: Bates v. United States
question: Does 20 USC section 1097(a), which makes it a felony "knowingly and willfully" to misapply student loan funds insured under Title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965, require an allegation and proof that a defendant specifically intended to injure or defraud either the United States as loan guarantor or another?

name: Forney v. Apfel
question: Can a Social Security disability claimant seeking court reversal of an agency decision denying benefits appeal a district court order remanding the case to the agency for further proceeding?

name: Forney v. Apfel
question: Can a Social Security disability claimant seeking court reversal of an agency decision denying benefits appeal a district court order remanding the case to the agency for further proceeding?

name: Regions Hospital v. Shalala
question: Is the Secretary of Health and Human Services' "reaudit" rule a reasonable interpretation of the GME Amendment of the Medicare and Medicaid Budget Reconciliation Amendments of 1985?

name: Regions Hospital v. Shalala
question: Is the Secretary of Health and Human Services' "reaudit" rule a reasonable interpretation of the GME Amendment of the Medicare and Medicaid Budget Reconciliation Amendments of 1985?

name: Regents of University of California v. Doe
question: Does the Eleventh Amendment shield state-run schools from being sued unwillingly in federal court even though any award of monetary damages would not come from the state?

name: Regents of University of California v. Doe
question: Does the Eleventh Amendment shield state-run schools from being sued unwillingly in federal court even though any award of monetary damages would not come from the state?
